snippet: General Motors posted a 6 percent increase and Ford Motor a 5 percent rise as Americans continue to buy the larger vehicles instead of cars.
abstract: Autodata reports car industry sold 1.45 million vehicles in April 2015, up 4.6 percent from year-ago period; seasonally adjusted annual rate rose to 16.5 million, up 450,000 from April 2014; Americans continue to favor trucks and SUVs.
lead_paragraph: General Motors posted a 6 percent increase and Ford Motor a 5 percent rise as Americans continue to buy the larger vehicles instead of cars.

headline.main: U.S. Auto Sales Jumped in April, Again Led by S.U.V.s and Pickups
headline.print_headline: Behind Rising U.S. Sales, Buyers Who Like S.U.V.s and Trucks

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Sports Utility Vehicles and Light Trucks
